options.content:
CPU load as shown by top and other tools. It is the number of threads in runnable state. It should not considerably exceed 100%. 

If the CPU load is very high it will cause performance problems. This may be due to slow CPUs or too small service heap space. Adjust MAX_MEM_*

Shows page faults per second. This means data had to be loaded from disk because it did not fit into RAM.
For metadata service this means usually that the footprint of database checkpoints exceeds the amount of memory available.

Check your memory setup or get more RAM.
If heap usage is at 100% for a longer period of time, increase heap space.

Lookup latency for data in checkpoints. 

High latency either means that data had to be fetched from disk (see page fault rate) or CPU is busy.
Full stack latency including replication and persistence.
Replication latency measured by the primary, ie. network roundtrip and backup persistence.

Processing and persistence latency measured on backup replicas.

A delta between "Replication roundtrip latency" and "Backup processing latency" indicates network problems.

Metadata service throttles client RPCs because it can't keep up with processing. 

Should always be zero.

Metadata service failing client RPCs because it can't keep up with checkpointing. 

Should always be zero.
If heap usage is at 100% for a longer period of time, increase heap space.

Incoming request cannot be handled because of backpressure. This can be due to busy devices or buffer memory limits.

If devices are not saturated, increase MAX_BUFFER_DATA.
Displays the number of open files per host.

Displays devices that show high utilization over time.
Devices shown here can be considered a bottleneck. 

Use more devices e.g by increasing stripe width or use faster devices.
Replication latency measured by the primary, ie. network roundtrip and backup persistence.

panels.description:
Interprets device latency reads from data service.

You should be able to identify saturated disks.
panels.title: Read Bands: Page Cache, Device Reads Relaxed, Device Reads Busy

panels.description:
Interprets devicewrite latency from data service.

You should be able to identify saturated disks.
panels.title: Write Bands: Device Writes Relaxed, Device Writes Busy
